results.title: ARD Design
results.overview: ARD Design is an architecture consultant company, based and founded in Jakarta, Indonesia, 1996. They had many collections of portfolio from their early years to present times.

article.content: ARD Design is an architecture consultant company, based and founded in Jakarta, Indonesia, 1996. They had many collections of portfolio from their early years to present times.
ARD already had a website that embodies their creative taste, with interactivity, animation, and smooth transition. The problem was, to achieve all those elements, the previous website used Flash.

The problem with Flash in this case that it requires loading until every content are loaded. Since ARD have a lot of projects inside their website, waiting became very long. And to be relevant at this time and age, they want it to be fast.
In short, they want to show their creative side and be fast.
To answer their need of a website that reflects their identity and with faster loading, I proposed to approach things from something simple. Their unique color palette from their logo.

article.label: The brown color was a bit different to draw more contrast from the logo

article.content: As for creative tastes, the people from ARD proposed using some of their already-made sketches.
Then, I started combining these elements, designing a prototype of the homepage using direct code.

The goal for showing the prototype is to see if the color palette goes well. I use the brown and orange combination for a nice contrast. As for the beige color, I got some difficulties on deciding where to put them. I decided that it would be best to use them as selection color.
Thankfully, they were satisfied with the combination. After I got the approval to move on, I continued designing the homepage and also started designing other pages.
Here's the end results of the project:
The first thing that most people will see. It has a collection of featured portfolios handpicked using a custom CMS. It is also where people could see the clients ARD Design had worked with.
The main piece of the website. It had every ARD Design's portfolios with three filter options.
This page shows the details. You can see the curated artworks of a project and the story behind it.
Where people can see the background and culture of ARD Design, as well as the people behind it.
Where ARD design can share their thoughts.
If you want to get in touch with the people at ARD Design, use this page.

A company website portfolio would be more usable with a backend side. I use AdminLTE control panel template for a quick and easy design process. Denis, a friend of mine, takes care of anything backend-side like database models.

article.alt: CMS dashboard, settings, project list, edit project

article.content: This is the first website project where I involved heavily on design. My design work here were done directly into code. For the next project, I would like to learn to design from wireframes and if possible, try to look into the research aspect of UX design.
You might also notice that many of the content on this project are still using lorem ipsum filler text. If you're interested on the copywriting gig, please contact me.

results.title: Bimata's Storywork
results.overview: The Storywork is a project from my high school times where I publish my fictions. It can be short story, flash fiction, song lyric, anything that I wrote or collaborated.

article.content: The Storywork is a project from my high school times where I publish my fictions. It can be short story, flash fiction, song lyric, anything that I wrote or collaborated. As a high school student with limited technical knowledge, I could only afford to use blogspot, a free blogging platform.
After I graduated from college, things become different. I have more technical knowledge than before. Then I started to have this need to always try to create something, to always learning.
"Why don't I started develop a website for the Storywork?"
It makes sense. I can use this as my portfolio and I also wanted learn more about developing from WordPress, one of the best blogging platform that's also a CMS. So, for me it's a big win.

I want the new website to have a distraction-free environment, to have a better reading experience. I look for inspirations and found this clean looking template. I decided to use this template as the basis of my custom WordPress template and customize it more for anything I need.
Here's the end result of the project:
The home page shows the most recent stories I publish. Refresh this page for keep you posted.
Every story falls in post type content. It has a comment section for interaction. Readers can also share my stories using social media of their choice.
Aside from short story and flash fiction, the post category can also serves as series chapter page should I publish story series in the future.
For non-story type of content. Like for example, an about page.
I was happy to learn a lot about WordPress in this project. Adding some kind of visual illustration for each story will be my next exploration.

results.title: Frienemies
results.overview: Ever heard of Bishi Bashi? The three of us, me, Dimas, and Chris decided to make our final thesis project a tribute for this game. Frienemies, to put plainly, means friends and enemies. To us, it means a friend who can be a rival. We felt it's the perfect title for the gameplay of this game where every player strives to be the very best.

article.content: Ever heard of Bishi Bashi? A good old party game that can made you destroy your precious controller? The three of us, me, Dimas, and Chris were having a blast playing this game. Each of us used to made this game a some kind of fun competition on saturday night with our respective friends.

article.label: Okay, not always saturday night. But you get my point.

article.content: Inspired, we decided to make our final thesis project a tribute for this game.

Frienemies, to put plainly, means friends and enemies. To us, it means friends who can be rivals. We felt it's the perfect title for the gameplay of this game where every player strives to be the very best.

We started from user research phase. In this phase we use quantitative research by spreading online surveys to 79 participants who had played a party game. The purpose is to understand their preferences about some elements of the gameplay.
The purpose of this question is to decide the type of controls for our mini games. Most of the participants prefers using <strong>virtual buttons</strong.
The purpose of this question is to decide the overall duration of our mini games. About 48% of the participants prefer 60 seconds.
We observe three games with similar genre with Frienemies: Bishi Bashi, Mucho Party, and King of Party.

Bishi Bashi has 48 mini game available and can be played up to 8 players. There are also AI players for single play. Each mini game has a theme, use speed and precision to achieve scores higher than other players. This game is released for PlayStation 1.

Mucho Party has 3 free mini games and a total of 30 mini games if bought. Players must selfie and use their face as the avatar. There are 6 mode available to choose and 50 achievements. Players must use speed and precision to achieve highest score. This game is released for Android and iOS.

King of Party is an online party game that use Facebook for player connection. It has 4 default mini games and player can buy more using gem, a currency within the game. Players can also buy item for their custom avatar. It can be played up to 4 players. This game is released for Android and iOS.
From these research and observations, we decided to made Frienemies:

list.content: Can be played up to 4 players
Three mini games, each of us develop one
Each mini game with overall duration of 15 to 60 seconds

article.content: As for the mini games, these are the concept that was on our mind.
After the decision has been made, we sketch the wireframes using MS Paint to have a grasp of how Frienemies would look like.
Here's the end result of the project:
The first page of the game. Players can configure some settings first, or just directly play.

If players hit play button, this page is shown. Players who want to join must tap their respective avatar. There will be visual cue for ready players. The positions of the players here will be consistent with player control placements throughout the whole game.
Players can choose one from three mini games they want to play.

Developed by Chris. Players are given 15 seconds to tap their respective buttons. Each tap will increase their respective powers. Player with the most powers after 15 seconds have passed is the winner.

Developed by Dimas. Players must pass the bomb to the next player after tapping the bomb between one to three times. Tapping will decrease the countdown. Bomb will be passed between players clockwise. The first player to get the bomb is random. The countdown is also random ranging between 15 to 30. Player who had the bomb when the countdown turns zero gets eliminated. The last player standing is the winner.

Developed by me. Players must reach the white finish line to win. When moving forward, players must see the direction Daruma is facing. When Daruma faces the players, they must not move. Otherwise it's fine to move. If a player move when Daruma is facing them, they will explode and must start over. The time Daruma takes to face the players is random.
Shows information on how many win each player has.
Players can set sound and music volume here. There are also a choice to hide tutorial for each mini game.
Where we put our names. We wanted to get recognized.

Our original plan for Frienemies was to be played as a multiplayer online game. The reason it turns out to be a local multiplayer game was because we don't have much time and resources to develop the online multiplayer feature. We have plans for it, but the feature won't be available in the foreseeable future.
That being said, we were happy with how the game turns out. We got to learn how design and develop a mobile game from the ground up, and to finally publish it online.

results.title: Metakom
results.overview: Metakom is a one-stop MEP design consultant in Indonesia that has expertise in mechanical engineering, electrical engineering, and building transport engineering. Starting from 1990, they have various projects across cities in Indonesia.

article.content: Metakom is a one-stop MEP design consultant in Indonesia that has expertise in mechanical engineering, electrical engineering, and building transport engineering. Starting from 1990, they have various projects across cities in Indonesia.

My role was to wrote the front-end code for this project and to collaborated closely with Viola, the web designer. She consulted me for technical limitations and design possibilities that she could consider and use in her design. Here’s the result:
The first page that most people will first see. It shows in a glance what Metakom is all about.
The page shows the most ambitious projects Metakom had over the years.
The details of project. You can see the curated artworks here as well as some info about the project like the architect behind it.
Where Metakom shows their philosophy, their vision and mission, their many expertise, and the people behind their teams.
This page shows the clients they had worked closely with.
If you want to get in touch with Metakom, use this page.

results.title: Regal Lite Ver.
results.overview: Since 1952, Regal has been the number one brand of Marie Biscuits in Indonesia. In 2014 & 2015, Regal Marie Biscuits achieved the “Top Brand” in the Marie Biscuit category in Indonesia.

article.content: Since 1952, Regal has been the number one brand of Marie Biscuits in Indonesia. In 2014 & 2015, Regal Marie Biscuits achieved the “Top Brand” in the Marie Biscuit category in Indonesia. Beyond the domestic market, Marie Regal is also distributed internationally and it is also successful in winning several awards and trophies at several food expos and trade shows in the Netherlands, Japan, Germany, Bulgaria, Poland, Italy, Yugoslavia, Thailand, France and the United States.

Their main website took the form of a kingdom with various objects like royal castle, airport, and buildings that users can interact. With such complex form, this main version is best viewed from desktop and not so much on mobile. Hence the need of a lite version.
My role was to wrote the front-end code for this project. Here’s the result:
The front page that shows the current products of Regal.
Here, the biscuit products are explained with more detail.
This page shows the main ingredients of Regal biscuits.
This page shows the process of Regal biscuits.
Regal can share their news here.
This page shows Regal’s address from around the world.
If you want to get in touch with Regal, use this page.

results.title: Adelle Jewellery
results.overview: Adelle is a jewellery e-store with their brand inspired by Kaizen, an ancient japanese wisdom. Itʼs a philosophy that fuels their passion for constant and never-ending improvement in everything they do for excellence.

article.content: Adelle is a jewellery e-store with their brand inspired by Kaizen, an ancient japanese wisdom. Itʼs a philosophy that fuels their passion for constant and never-ending improvement in everything they do for excellence. Over the years, Adelle Jewellery has tried itʼs best to bring people the perfection of timeless natural diamond beauty within itʼs pieces.
My role was to wrote the front-end code for this project. Here’s the result:
The front page of the website. It shows current promotions from Adelle as well as their best selling products and new collections.
This page shows many of their available products, depends on what category that users seek.
The details of a product. Users can buy through this page as well as checking the specifications and reviews.
Users must login first to buy their favourites.
Users can keep their favourites here for later transactions.
A page for any content, like an about page.
Where Adelle can share their thoughts.
Feel lost? This collection of guides will help you find your way.

results.title: Solusi Sejuk
results.overview: Solusi Sejuk is an air conditioner (AC) renting service. They rented out their AC for a monthly payment and they also take care of maintenance cost. This serves as a solution for people who feel that buying and maintaining an AC are expensive.

article.content: Solusi Sejuk is an air conditioner (AC) renting service. They rented out their AC for a monthly payment and they also take care of maintenance cost. This serves as a solution for people who feel that buying and maintaining an AC are expensive.
My role was to wrote the front-end code for this project. Here’s the result:
The front page of Solusi Sejuk. Here, they show the benefits of their services, testimonials, as well as their clients.
In this page, they explain about the details for renting their AC. There’s also a form people can use to get in touch and start subscribing.
Solusi Sejuk also provided the means of buying AC through installment.
In here, Solusi Sejuk explains their three core values: Easiness, Quality, and Speed.
Use this page if you want to get in touch with Solusi Sejuk.

results.title: Ramayana
results.overview: Space: The final frontier. These are the voyages of the Starship, Enterprise. Its five-year mission: To explore strange new worlds, to seek out new life and new civilizations, to boldly go where no man has gone before.

article.content: Space: The final frontier. These are the voyages of the Starship, Enterprise. Its five-year mission: To explore strange new worlds, to seek out new life and new civilizations, to boldly go where no man has gone before.
